text:
:champagne: _You have opened a new, empty shared channel._ 
_Share <https://www.smooz.io/room/5bed749c9efc760004fbfcd8|this link> with other teams to invite them in it_
<@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-5" to "neill-and-sophie"
name: neill-and-sophie

text:
Sophie, please meet Neill your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about! Feel free to introduce yourselves and continue chatting within this channel :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :smile:

Hi Neill, thank you for connecting with me! I’m currently a digital media arts student at the University of Surrey. I finished my second year in June and currently doing a placement year before I return for my third year in September next year. So this has been an opportunity for me to gain experience in the industry. I’m currently a runner at Evolutions post productions in Soho but my contract ends at the end of this year and I would love to get some experience/an internship with a VFX house for the rest of my placement year as I want to be a compositor. I was wondering if you had any advice of how I could get an internship or experience with a VFX house? I have a CV and portfolio/show reels but not sure if I have the relevant experience/work to secure a placement?

Hi Sophie, Pleased to meet you! Just so you know a little about me... I am a senior compositor at Framestore London, I have been in the VFX industry since 2012 when I graduated from the BA computer animation arts course at bournemouth uni. I have worked at framestore for that whole time and have moved from being a junior paint and roto artist to head of paint and roto to junior compositor and then to senior compositor over the 6 years. Before I went to bournemouth uni I was a pro photographer for 12 years.

I'm not sure about other companies, but here the internship program runs over the summer and I think you can apply online. In my experience the people that tend to remain employed by a company rather than jumping from short contract to short contract are the compositors that start out in paint and roto. This gives a strong grounding in the necessary software and techniques but without quite as much pressure as a comp role. Have you considered building a paint and roto reel and taking that route?

Pleasure to meet you too! It’s really interesting to here the career path you took, I hope I could follow suit and set on the same path. The summer internship is definitely something I would like to apply for. It sounds like paint and roto are also a good route to go, I have some roto work in my current compositing show reel but could possibly put some more in, so I could work on that. Do you think there’s any possibility that any companies may take me on as a roto/paint artist for the remainder of my placement year, even if I would only be able to stay until September?
